text:
The Nifty Futures on the Singapore Exchange, an early indicator of Nifty performance in India, declined 0.3 percent to 8,817.Yesterday, Indian shares gained for a sixth straight month, led by banks and auto companies, as global funds remained buyers despite the prospect of U.S. borrowing costs rising.  
Here are all the stocks to watch today
Reliance Industries, ONGC: AP Shah panel says the two oil firms knew about continuity of the gas reservoirAuto companies to release August car sales dataBharti Airtel: May consider listing Nigerian unitCCI imposes penalty on 10 cement firms for cartelizationHCC: Says debt to reduce to half with cabinet decision on arbitration awardIndian Oil Corp, HPCL, BPCL: Raises gasoline, diesel pricesNMDC: To bid for iron ore mines in KarnatakaTata Motors: Court orders return of West Bengal landHindalco rated new underperform at Macquarie ResearchTata Power: Javelin JV looks to develop missile systemThermax: Invested Rs 6 crore to raise stake in First Energy to 54.67 percentUniply Industries: To acquire architecture firm Vector Projects for Rs 64 croreAxis Bank: Goldman Sachs sold 13.2 million shares yesterday; Integrated Core sold 16.8 million; Ishares India Index bought 12 million shares, NSE saysBHEL: India Ratings downgrades AA+; outlook negativeC&C Constructions: Wins order valued at Rs 73.61 crore from Power GridGlaxoSmithKline Pharma: Considering options for Thane land saleInterGlobe, Jet Airways, SpiceJet: IOCL cuts jet fuel price by 3.8 percent in Delhi from todayBPCL refining margin seen at $5-$5.5 a barrel in FY17, Chairman saysKEC International: Wins new orders valued at Rs 1220 crore from India, Thailand, BangladeshMercator: Executive Vice Chairman Atul Agarwal resignsNava Bharat Ventures: Trades ex-bonusNestle India: Nestle Nigeria has “supply challenges” and not problem with demandNMDC: To bid for iron ore mines in Karnataka, Rao saysPhoenix Mills: Report of mall stake sale speculativePraj Industries: Closes Praj Sur America SRL in ArgentinaRS Software: Develops Bharat Bill Payment System’s central unitSurya Roshni: Report of Warburg, Bain buying unit speculativeYes Bank: Goldman Sachs sold 2.12 million shares yesterday, Integrated Core sold 3.21 million; Ishares India Index bought 2.37 million shares, NSE says





Whose gas is it anyways?@TweshMishra reportshttps://t.co/IaKaqOSoa5— BloombergQuint (@BloombergQuint) August 31, 2016
title: Stocks to Watch: Reliance Industries, Cement Companies, Apollo Hospitals and More
